meanings.definition: Having a higher proportion of pulp.
meanings.sent1: The orange juice was pulpier than the apple juice.
meanings.sent2: The magazine paper was pulpier than the glossy brochure.
meanings.sent3: The pulpier orange juice made the morning routine more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling became pulpier with each retelling, like a juicy novel.
meanings.sent5: The pulpier texture of the fabric made it more comfortable to sit on.

meanings.sent1: This orange is pulpier than the one I had yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The pulpier fruit was more enjoyable to eat.
meanings.sent3: The pulpier orange surprised me with its burst of flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her voice became pulpier as she sang the emotional song.
meanings.sent5: The pulpier texture of the paper made it easier to tear.

meanings.sent1: The pulpier machine worked faster than the older one.
meanings.sent2: The pulpier process resulted in a higher yield of paper.
meanings.sent3: The pulpier method of juicing made a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The pulpier tree bore more fruit than the others in the orchard.
meanings.sent5: The pulpier soil led to a richer harvest this year.
